entry.title: TWO WEEKS WITH MOSTLY SUNNY CONDITIONS FOR THE UMPQUA VALLEY
entry.summary: May 20, 2025 4:00 a.m. The Umpqua Valley is slated to experience mostly sunny conditions for the next two weeks. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that not much active weather is expected in the near future. entry.title: LESS THAN 12 PERCENT OF BALLOTS IN WITH TUESDAY BEING ELECTION DAY
entry.summary: May 20, 2025 3:50 a.m. Less than 12 percent of ballots have come in for the 2025 Douglas County May Special Districts Election. County Clerk Daniel Loomis said 11.54 percent, or 10,105 ballots, have been received as of Monday afternoon. Loomis said that lags 5.34 percent behind the participation rate for the same point in...

entry.title: ROSEBURG CITY COUNCIL ADJUSTS FEES
entry.summary: May 20, 2025 3:40 a.m. Roseburg city fees for drinking water, storm drainage service and other services will increase on Tuesday, July 1st to reflect increased costs to provide those services. A city release said the Roseburg City Council recently approved a yearly update to general fees and water-related fees and established a new $100...

entry.title: REEDSPORT ANNOUNCES MAIN STREET TRADITION
entry.summary: May 20, 2025 3:30 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: The City of Reedsport has announced that Main Street Director Rosa Solano is leaving the program. entry.title: MERCY OUTPATIENT IMAGING WITH PET SCANNER OPEN HOUSE
entry.summary: May 20, 2025 3:20 a.m. Mercy Outpatient Imaging, in partnership with Heritage Imaging, will have an open house Thursday to showcase its state-of-the-art PET/CT scanner, which is one of only two fully digital scanners in Oregon. PET stands for Positron Emission Tomography. Mercy staff said PET is a test that uses special imaging cameras and...

entry.title: UMPQUA VALLEY YOUTH ORCHESTRA SPRING CONCERT TUESDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: May 20, 2025 3:05 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight: The Umpqua Valley Youth Orchestra will perform their Spring Concert Tuesday night at 7:00 pm. in the Jacoby Auditorium of Umpqua Community College.
